title: LangeTwins 2010 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Clarksburg)
description: Full of buttery, tropical flavors, it also has a barrel-infused taste of petroleum and char.

title: Chacewater 2009 Malbec (Red Hills)
description: Smelling of coconut on the nose, this Malbec is good, like a big mouthful of cherry pie.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2009 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: From a new Lake County producer, this Zin isn't very aromatic and it shows its alcohol, with an earthy finish.

title: McCay Cellars 2009 Paisley Red (Lodi)
description: This juicy and fruity wine is a blend of just slightly more than half Zinfandel, the rest Petite Sirah. It's full of ripe black and red fruit, with structured tannins that teeter on the edge of being overwhelming—until the finish gives exactly the right hit of spice.

title: Tyler Florence 2008 TF Zin Hoodoo Creek VIneyard Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Decadently jammed with aromas and flavors of dark plum, blackberry and chocolate, this has subtle layers of black licorice and brawny leather. With small amounts of Syrah and Petit Verdot, this powerhouse gets better in the glass. Chef-turned-vintner Tyler Florence suggests pairing it with osso bucco.

title: Scott Harvey 2008 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A pleasing, complex Zin from the oldest documented Zin vineyard in California, which has belonged to Scott Harvey since 1984. Dusty, with a hint of mint, this structured, berry-flavored wine is medium in weight, with a licorice undertone.

title: Midsummer Cellars 2011 Grenache Rosé (Yolo County)
description: This wine is deliciously dry and refreshing, with a pretty salmon hue. Made from Grenache, it smells of watermelon and strawberry and is perfectly balanced. Textured and easy to drink, this is an extremely pleasant wine for summer and beyond.

title: Terre Rouge 2009 L'Autre G-S-M (Sierra Foothills)
description: Terre Rouge's classic GSM is earthy, like a silken Pinot Noir, wafting with damp, earthy moss and mushroom aromas. It's very savory but has enough flavors of cranberry, bramble fruit and peppery spice on the finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2009 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: This is light in color and strikes the right strawberry tones. It's big and tannic, with weight and warmth on the finish.

title: LangeTwins 2008 Midnight Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: The Lange Twins are longtime growers in Lodi who also make their own wine, with the help of former Woodbridge winemaker David Akiyoshi. This Bordeaux blend is mostly Petit Verdot and Cabernet, with smaller amounts of Merlot and Malbec in the mix. The time this spent aging in French oak shows through in its minty, full mouthfeel and vanilla tannins.

title: Chatom Vineyards 2006 Vino Dolce Red (Calaveras County)
description: A sweet mix of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Cão, Souzão and Tinta Barroca that smells of melted chocolate over strawberries. The alcohol overwhelms the fruit's charm and makes it hard to discern the care that was taken in putting such grapes together.

title: Nottingham Cellars 2009 Micro-Lot Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Collin Cranor remains one of Livermore's most promising young winemakers and this wine proves the point, a blend from three vineyard sites. This has a very pretty raspberry nose and is well-balanced throughout, with blackberry, oak and black tea flavors giving it an intensity of purpose. Will age well over the next couple of years.

title: Sobon Estate 2009 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)
description: Yes this is a big boy but its chocolate and espresso mixed with dark caramel are so well defined, so bold that anyone looking for a serious example of mountain Primitivo need look no farther. The wine's cherry flavors are vibrantly balanced between an intensity of layered darkness and complexity.

title: Leonesse Cellars 2008 Vista Del Monte Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: All black cherry and blueberry jam, this South Coast Syrah is fruity and spicy, full and fleshy with pepper and cinnamon spice and a teaspoon of black tea playfully showing through. Consistent throughout, a wine that's easy to like and complex at the same time. It spent close to two years in French oak, 30% of it new.

title: Martin Ranch 2009 Thérèse Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyards Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A soft, round Malbec with nice texture and depth, its flavors dominated by blackberry and boysenberry with a spicy cinnamon and vanilla finish. Pair it with beefy, meaty dishes and all will be well in the world.

title: Nottingham Cellars 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Opens aromatically exhibiting lemon cheesecake, then delves into the rightful amount of apple and pear, finishing with a hearty helping of vanilla and caramel. Del Arroyo remains a source to watch in Livermore, especially for Chardonnay.

title: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Occasio, which has made a nice Fume Blanc for a couple of vintages now, is giving the world this, its first Chardonnay, a true to its French-oak-fermented style that's quite citrus-laden, tart, lean and mean and yet voluptuous, with its barrel age showing, and toasty on the finish.

title: Martella 2010 Mattern Ranch Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Full of red fruit, light and bright at first, then denser in flavor with savory notes amidst Zin's cherry-berry deliciousness. Grown on the Talmage Bench east of Hopland in Mendocino County, where a number of great Zins are born.

title: Leonesse Cellars 2008 Rock Creek Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dark berry fruit is on full display in this 100% Syrah, aged in new French oak for almost two years. Fleshy with white pepper, tar and leather, this wine is well-made and balanced despite the high alcohol, and plenty juicy on the tongue.

title: Andis 2009 Reserve, Goedeck-Liu Vineyard Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: A brambly, still-quite tannic 80% Petite Sirah with 20% Syrah that's full of dark plum and cherry jam flavors and a thread of coffee throughout that gets pleasantly perfumey over time.

title: Horse & Plow 2010 McFadden Farm Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Horse & Plow continues to make nice wines from organic grapes. This vintage shows a subtle lemon streak with a tiny smidge of tropical guava and is all-around balanced, steely and meaty at the same time without overdone oak. Golden honey and lemon finish things off.

title: Most Wanted Winery 2009 Indindoli Family Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Very rich aromatically in golden Santa Rosa plum, raisins and lemon chiffon, this new producer's Chardonnay has a touch of caramel popcorn and is delicately dense with a nice lift on the finish.

title: Simaine Cellars 2009 Elvie's Block, Larry Venturi Vineyards Carignane (Mendocino)
description: A truly lovely Carignane, organically grown, dry-farmed and from a single vineyard, a 100% varietal example of how well Carignane can grow in Mendocino when well-tended and allowed to be itself. Rich, luxurious and smooth, the wine is also dark and brooding, incredibly fruity, like a liquid cherry-raspberry tart topped with vanilla ice cream.

title: Lava Cap 2009 Estate Bottled Syrah (El Dorado)
description: A decadent, dark and meaty Syrah, with plenty of sauvage tendencies amid a rich, velvety texture that finishes long and lushly perfumed with sweet smoke. In a cool year in El Dorado, Lava Cap has reined in this Syrah's tannins and let its dark cherry and plum flavors take center stage.

title: Twisted Oak 2009 *%#&@! Red (Calaveras County)
description: A deliciously priced blend of 60% Mourvèdre, 13% Syrah and 27% Grenache that'll be tricky to ask for by name but is worth the effort to find and share. This blend shows off brooding dark dollops of spicy fruit, herb and tobacco that are tenaciously balanced by the cherry tones from the Grenache. A fun wine to pass around at parties and barbecues.

title: Lee Family Farm 2009 Rio Tinto, Silvaspoons Vineyard Red (Alta Mesa)
description: A beautiful, bargain-priced blend of Tinta Roriz (aka Tempranillo), Touriga Nacional, Touriga Francesa and Alvarelhão. Violet and jasmine perfumed, this wine is so, so pretty with just a stunning nose. In taste, there's raspberry, strawberry and lilting layers of pepper and herbs. An intriguing wine well worth trying, made by Morgan Winery Winegrower Dan Lee.

title: Matchbook 2010 Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This crisp Chardonnay has a disjointedness about it. Its aroma and flavor is most akin to Lemonheads candy.

title: Beaver Creek 2008 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Beaver Creek's Lake County Zin is juicy and spicy, full of stewy red fruit and rough-hewn tannins that are thick and fragrant of oak and molasses. Definitely big though well made for its style. Time and air are its friends.

title: Saint Gregory 2009 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: An earthy, light Mendocino Pinot from a fabulous vintage that's got all the cherry, dusty mushroom flavors one could want, with a smidgen of black pepper on the finish. The bottle's suggestion to pair with Coq au Vin is a good one.

title: Wente 2010 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: A crowd-pleasing Chardonnay from Wente, working in the Monterey area, the result all caramel, vanilla and lemon-lime with a sweet tropical chaser on the finish. The oak is subtle. This wine will pair deliciously with a range of food, particularly chicken and seafood.

title: Forenzo 2009 Pinot Grigio (Redwood Valley)
description: Ripe and floral, full of lemon, honey and pear, this Mendocino-grown Pinot Grigio is refreshing and bright with an underlying layer of sweet anise on the finish. Made from organically grown grapes, this light-drinking wine spent no time in oak.

title: Six Sigma Ranch 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Lake County remains a serious place for Cabernet Sauvignon and Six Sigma is one of its better Cab practitioners. This 2007 version all rich and yeasty baked bread until it delves into black olive, dark plum and black tea flavors, finished by caramel and vanilla, all in all a refreshingly light touch.

title: McGrail 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Another nice effort from McGrail, a Cab from their estate vineyards that shows dark plum, vanilla and tobacco and a soft roundness, all around its tannins crying out for red meat.

title: Cinnabar 2009 Sorcerer's Stone Red (California)
description: An unusual blend of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Teroldego, this spent just about two years in French oak. The Petite Sirah's dustiness hits first, before the wine's big, ripe fruit flavors develop too. Quite earth-driven, with a taste of anise even and a hit of gamey meat.

title: Six Sigma Ranch 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Six Sigma's workhorse Sauvignon Blanc is light and bright, like a lemon crisp enveloped by grapefruit and melon. It's fully stainless-steel fermented and ready for spring and summer.

title: Occasio 2009 Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: This is lovely in violet perfume and bacony leather, structured like a tall building and best left to mellow out for further development. Winemaker John Kinney destemmed without crushing to preserve as many whole berries as he could, and kept the wine fermenting at lower temperatures to tame the tannins.

title: Page Mill Winery 2008 Tazetta Vineyard Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Thick and concentrated, with brambly fruit and caramel from the American oak. The whole package is intense at first, but with air mellows into elegant flavors of red cherry and rich chocolate, and it would make a fine wine next to wintertime stews. Tasted two bottles with some bottle variation.

title: Vino Noceto 2008 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Crafted from five estate lots, Vino Noceto's Riserva is classic Foothills Sangiovese, with cranberry and dark cherry mingling around a light texture, high acidity and a smooth, caramel finish.

title: Andis 2009 Bill's Block Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Let this mountain-grown baby open, but once it does, Andis' Cab Franc has classic aromas. This spicy, woody and cola-esque wine would make a fine introduction to California Cabernet Franc, or a reminder of how good it can be when done nicely.

title: Esterlina 2010 Riesling (Cole Ranch)
description: Light in color and subtle in aromatics, Esterlina's Riesling is just slightly sweet in a tropical kind of way, but lightly and delicately so. Overall, very balanced, crisp and perfumed, this is an elegant wisp of a wine.

title: Cline 2010 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: Full of dark plum and earth, a tremendous old-school California Mourvedre from old Oakley vines that exude mushroomy soft tannins and a rounded spiciness, finished by a trace of chocolate.

title: Concannon 2009 Conservancy Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: A value-driven Cabernet to be sure and one, under the Conservancy mantra, that serves to raise funds to protect vineyard land from urban development. This vintage is full, with baked plum and earthy flavors, even-handed overall, with a hint of green bean on the finish.

title: Cuda Ridge Wines 2009 Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
description: The alcohol is overwhelming here in an otherwise fragrant wine with strong aromas of cola spice. This Petit Verdot is medium-bodied and very much happy to display its 18 months spent in new American oak.

title: Michael David 2009 Gluttony Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This Amador Zin has Lodi producer Michael David's signature bacon and oak, its 17 months in American oak having no place to hide. The wine's blackberry fruit tastes full, its tannins chewy. High-alcohol California mountain Zin at its most intense concentration.

title: Michael David 2009 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Michael David is clearly having fun here, calling it Rapture and scrawling on the back of each bottle, “Don't be left behind!” The wine is fun for big oak, big tannin and big fruit as it's true to its MD style, all toasted oak and molasses, dry epic tannins and jam.

title: Michael David 2009 Lust Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Nothing small about this wine. A super-dark, ripe, juicy Zin full of oak and bacon flavors, lusty in every imaginable way, but not for everyone. Aged 18 months in American oak and edging into Port territory, drink this in moderation or have a nap spot picked out nearby.

title: Lava Cap 2010 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)
description: Lava Cap Sauvignon Blanc is made from estate-grown grapes, then barrel ferments for a tropical, nutty, round version of the wine, with lots of creamy, tropical flavors. The finish shows off the wine's time in oak.

title: Chacewater 2009 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: A brawny, dusty Petite with ripe flavors of plum and black fruit enveloped by sticky tannins.

title: 3 Steves Winery NV Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Dark honey gold in color, this is reminiscent of cider. It's an interesting use of ripe Chardonnay, but finishes overly sour, almost bitter.

title: LangeTwins 2009 Estate grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Like liquid toasted cinnamon, this Cabernet Sauvignon is texturally harsh.

title: LangeTwins 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A huge, harsh Cabernet without much in the way of varietal character.

title: Terre Rouge 2009 Ascent Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Terre Rouge's loftiest undertaking every vintage, this Ascent is a blockbuster. It's gorgeously spicy and floral, with dark notes of pepper, violet and herb that will live long and prosper in time. Grapes used for this bottling are sourced from cool, high-elevation vineyards, providing the wine perfect balance between big, bold fruit and provocative acidity.

title: Baxter 2009 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Structured and fully developed, this showcases the strong 2009 vintage, the Oppenlander Vineyard and the brilliance that is Baxter. Marked by bright black-cherry fruit and a heady perfume of rose, this carries itself with elegance and a light touch. This is Pinot Noir purposely made to pair with food.

title: Twisted Oak 2008 The Spaniard Red (Calaveras County)
description: It may just be that this 84% Tempranillo blend (plus 12% Graciano, 4% Garnacha) needs some more time in bottle to develop, in which case it will only get better. In the meantime it has undeniable juicy, red fruit, grippy tannins that are just starting to mellow and is overall a very savory and delicious wine. Fermented as a field blend, The Spaniard mingled for months in all-new French oak and would go gangbusters with lamb or other red meats.

title: Precedent 2010 Evangelho Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: A full-bodied, full-flavored Zin, this is packed with baking spice, classic blackberry and leather notes. It has great length and a spicy finish, and it should please many California Zin fans.

title: Girasole 2010 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Packaged in an attractive sunflower-adorned screwcap bottle, this Chardonnay made from organic grapes is light, bright and straightforward—tasting of lemon, lime and kiwi—with barely any oak influence.

title: Topel 2007 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Following on the heels of the wonderful 2006 bottling, this has more tannin and less fruit, with a heavy presence of oak stepping in the way of the black cherry flavor. It was aged for 33 months in oak—50% new French oak.

title: Sobon Estate 2009 Fiddletown Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: This is a toasty Zinfandel bursting with aromas and flavors of smoked meat and blackberry jam. Soft, round and easy to drink, this should pair well with barbecue or similarly smoked meats.

title: Robledo 2011 Seven Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This is a slightly sweet Sauvignon Blanc that's shy on the nose, without much depth or breadth.

title: Chacewater 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Made from organically grown grapes, this crisp white flirts dangerously with herb and grass tones—what is often called gooseberry—before settling down. It's quite drinkable, if a bit heavy on the finish.

title: Parducci 2009 Small Lot Blend Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: This Merlot has good plum and cherry flavors up front and is straightforward enough to pair with just about any food, but the finish falls a bit flat.

title: Heron 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A simple, straightforward Cab. It shows herb and green pepper amid clove and currant and it's low enough in alcohol not to mess you up. A perfectly fine everyday wine.

title: Brass Tacks 2009 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: An inexpensive Merlot that's herbal. It also shows cranberry and menthol amid a light toasting of oak.

title: Perry Creek 2009 Zinman Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: Perry Creek's popular, well-priced Zinman shows off leathery, cola spice and blackberry flavors and fruit that's just at the precipice between ripe and overripe nice structure.

title: Gnarly Head 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This majority Zin with 18% Petite Sirah is a popular, widely available choice for many Zin loves. Its concentrated fists of sweetness—vanilla and cherry-based mostly—are hits with many consumers.

title: Concannon 2007 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: There's tobacco and chocolate throughout this highend Cab offering from Concannon. Maybe it's the vintage, maybe it's the time in bottle, but the wine's complexity appears limited.

title: Concannon 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A ripe Chardonnay, big and full, with fistfuls of oak influence and a spoonful of sugar to help it go down. Find some rich crab cakes in a creamy sauce and enjoy.

title: LangeTwins 2010 Pinot Noir (Clarksburg)
description: Though the alcohol level on this Pinot Noir is modest, the heavy handedness of the oak is high, with the wine taking on a burnt flavor—almost akin to barbecue-flavored CornNuts.

title: LangeTwins 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A smoky, oaky Zinfandel that's well-endowed, with a fuller-than-full body and a taste of bacon on the finish.

title: LangeTwins 2010 Viognier (Clarksburg)
description: There's a lot of barrel influence in this acidic Viognier that finishes with a metallic taste.

title: Green Truck 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine, made from organic grapes, opens with a nose of steely lemon but it devolves quickly into lemony cough drop territory, with a sourness in taste.

title: Capay Valley 2011 Viognier (Capay Valley)
description: There's a strong peach-fuzz aroma enveloping this wine. It's unoaked, tasting overly rich and oily.

title: 3 Steves Winery 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has very little going on aromatically and tastes slightly burnt.

title: 3 Steves Winery 2009 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A Livermore Chardonnay tasting of honey and sour green apple, this has a touch of sweetness on the finish.

title: Concannon 2010 Conservancy Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A fully rich yet integrated Chardonnay that offers great value and clean flavors of golden apple and yellow fig and plenty of crisp acidity on the finish.

title: Martin Ranch 2007 Thérèse Vineyards Madeline Vineyards Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A superdark, marshmellowy Petite Sirah that's grapey good, very jammy, surrounded by cinnamon and nutmeg. Grown eight miles east of the Santa Cruz Mountains, Martin Ranch's Petite is of course, not petite, but chewy and good, in search of a good hunk of meat.

title: Yorkville Cellars 2010 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)
description: A glass of pretty aromatics, grapefruit and orange blossom mostly, with a range of depth and texture that speaks of serious wine. Made from organic grapes.

title: Sierra Vista 2008 Red Rock Ridge Syrah (El Dorado)
description: Let this Syrah open, but once it does, it is full of raspberry, black pepper, oak and gamy goodness, medium-bodied, elegant and nicely in balance.

title: Sierra Vista 2009 Fleur de Montagne Red (El Dorado)
description: If you love old-world Rhônes, Sierra Vista is a producer to know about. This blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Cinsault is medium in weight and easy to drink and love, tinged with hints of lavender, cherry and baked bread.

title: McFadden NV Brut Sparkling (Potter Valley)
description: Though nonvintage, 100% of the half Chardonnay and half Pinot Noir grapes in this sparkling blend hail from 2009, a nice vintage for Mendocino. With a yeasty nose this Brut is all green apple tartness with high notes of acidity, and very dry. As it opens it gets more fragrant, pleasantly tasting of honeysuckle, nectarine and sweet fig.

title: Sierra Vista 2009 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: In previous years Sierra Vista used its Grenache only as a blender but no more. This bottling shows its rightful place as a standalone, savory and very herbal with meat and baking spices aplenty and all the bright, clean red raspberry and strawberry fruit a subtle Grenache can offer, all at a low alcohol level.

title: McCay Cellars 2008 Equity Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Soft and dense with dark fruit, almost baked fruit flavors, that veer into nuts and vanilla, an easy-drinking Zin blended with a smidge of Zin from the 2009 and 2010 vintages as well as 7% Petite Sirah crafted by a Lodi producer to watch.

title: Andis 2009 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: No doubt this is mountain grown Zin, still tight but revealing nice aromatics of cherry and spicy licorice on the finish, accompanied by a healthy helping of espresso, wrapped in smooth tannins all around. Should only get better over the next year or two.

title: Broll Mountain Vineyards 2007 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)
description: Black purple, this older Petite has a deeply perfumed nose of licorice and chocolate and is very drinkable now.

title: Most Wanted Winery 2008 Garcia Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cab opens with soy and molasses and then moves seamlessly into a mouthful of blackberry jam. Dense, it's still young but should develop well.

title: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2010 Grenache Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: New producer Hannah Nicole has done a nice job, working in a light style, sourcing from Grenache Noir grapes and fermenting in 100% stainless steel. Totally dry, the wine is all strawberry and watermelon, with a tiny note of wax like the kind found around Bonbel cheese.

title: Martella 2009 Fairbairn Ranch Syrah (Mendocino)
description: From a certified biodynamic vineyard, this Syrah is big red wine, tannic with black fruit and game in taste and smell.

title: Concannon 2008 Nina's Cuvee Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Nina's has an oaky nose with roasted, nutty aromatics, and in flavor just teeters over the acceptable brink of enjoyable intensity. Lots of baked plum that's quite nice.

title: Yorkville Cellars 2010 Randle Hill Vineyard Sémillon (Yorkville Highlands)
description: A subtle Sémillon that would make for a delightful apéritif or pair expertly with seafood, its crème brûlée and citrus—mostly grapefruit and lime—go easy on the tongue.

title: Lorenzi Estate NV Bacio Zinfandel Dessert Wine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
description: From the land of the old vine Zinfandel grapes comes Bacio, a Port-in-color dessert Zinfandel that's got some nice baked fruit flavors and a taste of dust; its sweetness lingers and a little goes a long way.

title: Concannon 2009 Conservancy Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This has flavors of dark cherry and mint that hover above its herbal tendencies. It resolves nicely on the finish, with flavors of juicy plum and black tea.

title: Mad Housewife 2009 Merlot (California)
description: This is a Merlot with dark plum flavors, integrated tannins and good structure. Juicy fruit and an appropriate level of herbaceousness in the background.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2008 Signature Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (South Coast)
description: There's no denying the showy, ripe fruit that emanates from the bottle—a mix of herbal cranberry and caramel. It's soft and round, and if you're interested in how Cabernet from the South Coast can taste, this one's worth a try.

title: Girasole 2010 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: There aren't too many California Pinots lying around at $16. A Pinot made from organic grapes, this has a strawberry note in the foreground, followed by a peppery, spicy undertone. With its weight and depth on the finish, it'll hold up to a range of meals.

title: Bokisch 2008 Las Cerezas Vineyard Graciano (Mokelumne River)
description: Fruity, dusty and soft, a dark cherry and plum Graciano grown and made in Lodi with great depth, balance and earthiness. The grape is native to Rioja where it is usually blended with Tempranillo, but does deliciously here on its own. From Lodi Rules Certified Green grapes.

title: Jason-Stephens 2007 Estate Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This has smooth tannins and plenty of bright fruit flavor. Made in a savory style, the finish on this wine has a leathery bite to it.

title: Occasio 2011 Del Arroyo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)
description: Slightly austere, this Pinot Gris is marked by aromas of orange blossom and cheese rind, with a crispness on the finish that resembles a ripe, green apple.

title: Shannon Ridge 2010 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: Grown in the High Valley appellation within Lake County, this is huge, black and packed with blackberry and blueberry flavors. It's decadent like a blueberry pie topped with chocolate sauce. Ready to drink now.

title: Jason-Stephens 2007 Estate Meritage (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Comprised of 48% Cabernet Sauvignon, 47% Merlot and 2.5% each of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this Santa Clara Valley red is bursting with rich, big fruit, ending with a quick finish.

title: flipflop NV Headshrinker Sweet Red Blend Red (California)
description: This is sweet and simple, but its slight burn on the finish makes it harder to swallow.

title: Wattle Creek 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)
description: With layers of nutty, toasty oak flavors lingering in the background, this is a Sauvignon Blanc with lushness to its core of melon, guava and grass notes.

title: Wildhurst 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: With no time spent in oak, this bright, simple Sauvignon Blanc has pear, grapefruit and gooseberry notes and a quick finish.

title: Peirano 2009 The Other White (Lodi)
description: This Lodi-grown blend of 65% Chardonnay, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier smells of marshmallow, coconut and bubble gum.

title: Terre Rouge 2008 Muscat a Petits Grains Vin Doux Naturel Muscat (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Bill Easton doesn't make this dessert wine every year, so when he does, especially of this caliber, it's a good time to pick up some of this deliciously balanced dessert delight. It's a very nuanced rendering of crisp, clean peach, pear and honey flavors that would go well with fruit desserts or anything involving almond paste.
designation: Muscat a Petits Grains Vin Doux Naturel

title: Cedarville 2009 Turnabout's Red (Fair Play)
description: Cedarville's ode to Priorat, this is a mix of 45% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon. The three get along swimmingly, amusingly mixing into a triad of dark blackberry, dark licorice and dark chocolate. The rich texture is on the mark, and the wine provides just the right heft for any spicy, brawny meal.

title: Sorelle Winery 2010 Grazia Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: A straightforward, subtle version of Pinot Grigio, light in alcohol, a good choice as an apéritif or as an accompaniment to a light lunch. A lean lemon quality dominates its flavors and aromas.

title: Domenico 2006 Aglianico (Amador County)
description: This Amador Aglianico tastes of intense black cherry and dusty coffee. It exhibits all the qualities of a mature wine, with firm, dry tannins and flavors of black olive and pepper, especially on the finish. Pair it with heavy, meaty dishes cooked with vegetables.

title: Chatom Vineyards 2009 Cuvee Red (Calaveras County)
description: A blend heavily weighted toward Merlot and Syrah, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, this red blend is a nice mix of dry cranberry and raspberry flavors, with dry tannins and a long finish.

title: Di Arie 2008 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: Soft and round, with an explosive burst of candied fruit on the palate, this Barbera has concentrated flavors of dried cherry, plum and milk chocolate, the latter of which pops on the finish.

title: Concannon 2009 Reserve Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
description: A big but not-too-tannic Petit Verdot, this is juicy and structured with red fruit and a light layer of spice. Tending toward black licorice and dark chocolate, it could use a splash of something to brighten it up. But it's otherwise a bottle worth trying if you're curious to try a varietal Petit Verdot.

title: Rock View 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: As this tastes pineapple-sweet, with a rich, creamy mouthfeel, it is for Chardonnay drinkers who prefer the popular style. The wine is best served chilled with similarly rich, creamy food.

title: Gen5 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This starts out with cranberry and dark cherry flavors, with a hint of blackberry. It has good tannin structure but not much depth. Simple, it's ready to drink now.

title: Duarte Georgetown 2009 Georgetown Divide, Rouge Grenache Rosé (El Dorado)
description: Dark in color, this rosé made from Grenache grapes is quite sour and a little off-balance, though the bottle it comes in is very pretty.

title: Healdsburg Ranches 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Floral and a tad vegetative, this Cab is decent at first, but quickly turns disjointed and donut-y.

title: Jeriko 2011 Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Made from certified biodynamic grapes and the Musqué clone, this is crisp with a creamy texture and a long finish. Tasting of brioche, lemon chiffon and wood, it screams out for seafood.

title: Martin Ranch 2009 J.D. Hurley Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Martin Ranch makes a consistently good Merlot, this one marked by sweet red fruit and licorice, with layers of cinnamon spice. Full-bodied and meaty, its layers are concentrated enough to stand up to steak or hamburgers.

title: Tortoise Creek 2011 Jam's Blend Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Full of flavors and aromas of grapefruit and pear, this delightful Chardonnay is super-crisp, with restrained barrel influence. Like a freshly baked pie, it's bright and satisfying.

title: Michael David 2010 Freakshow Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Michael David's Freakshow is predictably freaky, big in oak and concentrated fruit. But its juicy and robust nature is hard to dislike. The dark cherry and savory baking-spice flavors meld into the soft tannins, creating a crowd-pleasing example of California's agricultural generosity.

title: Concannon 2008 Mother Vine Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine adds to the growing case to be made for Cabernet Sauvignon in Livermore Valley. Mother Vine Reserve is a smallish offering for Concannon, loaded with black olive, tea and black pepper. It's Cab Franc-esque in some way, yet intensely dark, brooding and velvety.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2008 Yalda Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This newish producer pays honor to its Persian roots with Yalda, a Rhône-style blend of 41% Shiraz, 26% Mourvedre, 25% Grenache and 8% Cinsault that's intense, coated like chocolate-strawberry jam, tobacco, leather and earth with a subtext of cheese rind. This wine definitely has character.

title: Tortoise Creek 2009 Cherokee Lane Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: From a single sustainably farmed vineyard in Lodi comes this super bang for your buck. It's earthy Cab that's perfumed inside and out, with wafts of cedar burning on an open fire, as well as brick, black cherry and clove. It's balanced and structured to boot.

title: Occasio 2009 Sotto Voce Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Winemaker John Kinney blends 50% Cabernet Sauvignon from Galles Vineyard with 50% Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah, trying to take advantage of the Cab's floral, herbal notes and the Petite's concentration and wall of tannins. He has largely succeeded. This dark-black wine is very much full of intense cherry and structured tannins and leathery spice. Petite Sirah lovers will particularly swoon.

title: Olabisi 2007 King Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Black and thick, this Petite Sirah delivers on all the variety's attributes in warm-climate California. It's blisteringly gregarious yet rounded, with smoky dark-fruit flavors that are initially hard to capture and tannins that verge on puckering. But time rewards—this wine hits its stride after being allowed to open and swirled around a few times. Enjoy it with a rich risotto or rack of ribs.

title: Clif Family 2011 Gewurztraminer (Mendocino)
description: A gorgeously perfumed, dry and lean white, this is light, crisp and bright, with just the right level of viscosity to pair with cheese, charcuterie or spicy chicken. Like those foods, it has a jolt of spice between its layers of lychee and clove flavors.
